title.narrative: Improve the quality of life and opportunities for young rural Ethiopians with cleft conditions by providing access to free treatment and building the patient referral skills of local health workers.

description.narrative: The project will enable 540 young people in the Somali region, one of the poorest regions in Ethiopia, to reach free treatment for cleft conditions, enabling them to eat, speak and breathe and to participate in community life. It will also build the skills of 150 local health workers in identifying cleft conditions and referring patients for treatment, and will facilitate the expansion of free cleft treatment to a local hospital – making access to treatment easier for many more young Ethiopians.;

sector.narrative: Access to free treatment for cleft conditions
